messages.title: A record of campaigning for our area
messages.content: James Flanagan is seeking your support to become an MP. With an outstanding record of public service, he is actively supporting the Kingsmead Field and The Oval open space campaigns, as well as campaigning for local people's priorities on reducing traffic speeds and levels.

messages.title: Who isn't standing up for our local NHS?
messages.content: In his time as the local MP, Julian Brazier has not stood up to the pressure of getting a publicly funded and publicly run NHS. The state of Kent & Canterbury hospital, the loss of the Accident & Emergency provision, suggests lack of action in speaking out against the cuts and ensuring an A&E service that is right on your doorstep.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Advocates for a publicly funded and run NHS and criticizes the current MP for not standing up against cuts and for the loss of the A&E service at the local hospital.
Supports the provision of more affordable and local needs housing.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet presents strategic voting considerations mentioning the local election results to suggest a shift away from the conservative vote.

issues.environment: Supports campaigns such as Kingsmead Field and The Oval open space.
issues.health: Criticizes the current MP for not effectively defending the local NHS and allowing the loss of A&E services.

housing.content: Promises more affordable and local needs housing.

leaflet.personalStatement: James Flanagan believes he is the best person to be the MP, emphasizing that an MP should put the interests of their constituency first.

politicalExperience.achievements: Has a record in economics and investment at university and now lives with his young family in Whitstable; active in local campaigns like Kingsmead Field and The Oval open space.

images.caption: Liberal Democrats - working hard all year round
James Flanagan - Passionate supporter of the Kent & Canterbury hospital and the Urgent Care Centre.
Supporting moves to reduce traffic speeds and levels.
A rail commuter himself, acutely aware of the shortcomings of local services.
Leading spokesperson and activist of the 'IN' referendum campaign.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet mentions fighting for a recall of MPs who switch parties during their term without a by-election. It also shows involvement in local campaigns and issues, with proactive approaches toward environment, healthcare, and housing.
